title: Mind the Prompt: Prompting Strategies in Audio Generations for Improving Sound Classification
author: Francesca Ronchini (Politecnico di Milano), Ho-Hsiang Wu (Bosch Center for Artificial Intelligence), Wei-Cheng Lin (Bosch Center for Artificial Intelligence), Fabio Antonacci (Politecnico di Milano), ...
relevance_why: The use of advanced prompting strategies in Text-to-Audio models directly relates to Haohe Liu's work on audio generation, potentially enhancing the effectiveness of generated datasets for sound classification.
background: This study explores strategies to generate synthetic audio datasets using Text-to-Audio models to improve sound classification accuracy in various tasks.
contribution: This paper introduces diverse prompt strategies for Text-to-Audio dataset generation to enhance sound classification tasks, achieving improved classification performance compared to baseline datasets.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods lacked the use of sophisticated prompting techniques and mainly employed simplistic templates.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by implementing task-specific prompt strategies and analyzing their effectiveness for audio generation, leading to more diverse and higher-quality datasets.

key_innovation: Incorporates advanced prompting strategies, including structured and exemplar-based prompting, significantly improving dataset generation for sound classification tasks.
real_world_impact: The findings can lead to enhanced sound classification systems with better performance, particularly in industries where accurate audio recognition is critical, such as surveillance and smart home technology.
limitations: The reliance on generated datasets may still face issues with audio quality and distribution mismatches, as highlighted by the authors.

new_terms.Text-to-Audio (TTA): **Text-to-Audio** refers to models that generate audio samples from textual prompts, enabling synthetic audio generation without the need for extensive real-world audio datasets.
new_terms.Large Language Models (LLMs): **Large Language Models** are AI systems designed to understand and generate human language, which can be utilized to improve the generation of prompts for audio generation tasks.
